title: Typewriter face query
content:
I know its a crap image but any help would be appreciated.

Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011015948im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/query_3545.jpg)

 [‹ "No Country For Old Men" film poster fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011015948/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44227 "Go to previous forum topic") [Production Department & Bas Jan Ader typefaces ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011015948/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44197 "Go to next forum topic")
author: smongey

comments.content: Back in the old days of typewriters, I remember there were two main font syles: elite and pica. This appears to be the elite style. You might look at Prestige Elite or, if it is too clean, I know P22 has a typeface named Typewriter which is a pretty good mix of clean and distressed.
Is the type in your image written by a real typewriter or is it a computer font, if you happen to know?
